As part of #15662, we made some changes to the formatting of zproject/prod_settings_template.py, and weâ€™re looking for feedback on whether this has positively or negatively impacted its clarity and usability. Where we previously used a space to distinguish commented prose from commented code (full file):

# EMAIL_HOST and EMAIL_HOST_USER are generally required.
#EMAIL_HOST = 'smtp.example.com'
#EMAIL_HOST_USER = ''

we now use ## (full file):

## EMAIL_HOST and EMAIL_HOST_USER are generally required.
# EMAIL_HOST = 'smtp.example.com'
# EMAIL_HOST_USER = ''

/poll Thoughts?
I prefer the version with space
I prefer the version with ##

I'm going to hijack stow away on this topic to promote the @selfhosters user group (and mention the group as I just did, for the two other people who are currently in it). It would be great to have more people who self-host Zulip in that group, e.g. for situations like this where a question is being directed at those people.

There's a topic at #general > @selfhosters. Let me know there or via PM (let's not clutter this topic) if you want me to add you to the @selfhosters group.
